jobDescription: Arcadis is seeking an Environmental Scientist with a minimum of 6 years post-graduate, non-academic, technical experience to be based in our Cranbury, NJ office. Successful candidate will be a key member of our team conducting environmental and remediation projects in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and elsewhere in the U.S. This is an opportunity for a dynamic individual looking for career growth in environmental consulting. In This full-time position, the successful candidate will manage and lead investigations, analyses, and reporting tasks associated with vapor intrusion, risk assessment, and regulatory compliance, and will work alongside and with senior level managers and technical resources.  Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to): Coordination of field sampling events for exterior soil gas, sub-slab soil gas, and indoor/outdoor air.Coordination of data management, data evaluation, and reporting for vapor intrusion investigations.Coordination of preparation of qualitative and quantitative human health risk assessments.Coordination of NJDEP regulatory compliance activities, such as data quality assessment/usability evaluations, alternative soil remediation standard calculations, site-specific impact-to-groundwater standard development, background evaluations, and compliance averaging.Preparation of technical reports, work plans, letters, and memoranda.Assist Project Managers and Technical Leads with site strategy development, and planning of investigation, risk assessment, and reporting tasks.Assist in cost estimation and proposal development, and managing task schedules and budgets.Prepare subcontracts and oversee the work of subcontractors.Exhibiting ownership of managed tasks, including responsibility for coordination and delivery of on-schedule and on-budget tasks. Responsibilities will include a combination of field and office related tasks, with primarily office responsibilities. Responsibilities include travel to client sites. This position is expected to be in the field less than 20% of the time.The successful candidate will be:Health and safety focused.Able to work successfully in both individual and team settings.Proficient in and have a strong interest in working with MS Excel.Knowledgeable of other MS Office applications (including MS Word and PowerPoint).Proficient in NJDEP, PADEP, and/or USEPA environmental regulations.Proficient in vapor intrusion investigation and human health risk assessment, including statistical analysis and exposure modeling. The successful candidate will possess excellent oral and written communication skills, effective time management skills, the ability to multi-task, and be able to provide the flexibility required to support different projects and managers concurrently.
